page.title: 04The Harbour Bridlington
page.content: Bridlington's Picuresque harbour is an important tourist attraction. In many ways, the town focuses on it still, and it is easily accessible from the town centre. A great deal of renovation and development has been done lately in the surrounding area. Trees have been planted and seats installed. Modern shops have been set in the north side and a pedestrian bridge crosses the Gypsey race river at Clough Hole. On the south pier there is a large fish shed. All around the harbour are small gift shops and sea food retailers. There is also a harbour museum. Entry to the harbour is difficult, a small sand bank called the Canch, in the harbour mouth causes problems .In the inner harbour is a yacht marina and regattas are often held. The steamers "Flambourian" &"Yorkshire Belle" operate from here.
